<a id="TileSetAtlasSource"></a>

# TileSetAtlasSource

**Inherits:** [TileSetSource](TileSetSource.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Exposes a 2D atlas texture as a set of tiles for a [TileSet](TileSet.md) resource.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

An atlas is a grid of tiles laid out on a texture. Each tile in the grid must be exposed using [create_tile()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_tile). Those tiles are then indexed using their coordinates in the grid.

Each tile can also have a size in the grid coordinates, making it more or less cells in the atlas.

Alternatives version of a tile can be created using [create_alternative_tile()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_alternative_tile), which are then indexed using an alternative ID. The main tile (the one in the grid), is accessed with an alternative ID equal to 0.

Each tile alternate has a set of properties that is defined by the source's [TileSet](TileSet.md) layers. Those properties are stored in a TileData object that can be accessed and modified using [get_tile_data()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_data).

As TileData properties are stored directly in the TileSetAtlasSource resource, their properties might also be set using ``TileSetAtlasSource.set("<coords_x>:<coords_y>/<alternative_id>/<tile_data_property>")``.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **TileAnimationMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode)

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_DEFAULT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode) **TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_DEFAULT** = `0`

Tile animations start at same time, looking identical.<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_RANDOM_START_TIMES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode) **TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_RANDOM_START_TIMES** = `1`

Tile animations start at random times, looking varied.<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode) **TILE_ANIMATION_MODE_MAX** = `2`

Represents the size of the [TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode) enum.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constants

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_H"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**TRANSFORM_FLIP_H** = `4096` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_H)

Represents cell's horizontal flip flag. Should be used directly with [TileMapLayer](TileMapLayer.md) to flip placed tiles by altering their alternative IDs.

```
    var alternate_id = $TileMapLayer.get_cell_alternative_tile(Vector2i(2, 2))
    if not alternate_id & TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_H:
        # If tile is not already flipped, flip it.
        $TileMapLayer.set_cell(Vector2i(2, 2), source_id, atlas_coords, alternate_id | TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_H)
```


\ **Note:** These transformations can be combined to do the equivalent of 0, 90, 180, and 270 degree rotations, as shown below:

```
    enum TileTransform {
        ROTATE_0 = 0,
        ROTATE_90 = TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_TRANSPOSE | TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_H,
        ROTATE_180 = TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_H | TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_V,
        ROTATE_270 = TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_TRANSPOSE | TileSetAtlasSource.TRANSFORM_FLIP_V,
    }
```


<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_V"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**TRANSFORM_FLIP_V** = `8192` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_V)

Represents cell's vertical flip flag. See [TRANSFORM_FLIP_H](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_H) for usage.

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_TRANSPOSE"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**TRANSFORM_TRANSPOSE** = `16384` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_TRANSPOSE)

Represents cell's transposed flag. See [TRANSFORM_FLIP_H](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_constant_TRANSFORM_FLIP_H) for usage.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_property_margins"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **margins** = `Vector2i(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_property_margins)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_margins**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_margins**\ (\ )

Margins, in pixels, to offset the origin of the grid in the texture.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_property_separation"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **separation** = `Vector2i(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_property_separation)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_separation**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_separation**\ (\ )

Separation, in pixels, between each tile texture region of the grid.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **texture** [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_texture**\ (\ value\: [Texture2D](Texture2D.md)\ )
- [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **get_texture**\ (\ )

The atlas texture.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture_region_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **texture_region_size** = `Vector2i(16, 16)` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture_region_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_texture_region_size**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_texture_region_size**\ (\ )

The base tile size in the texture (in pixel). This size must be bigger than or equal to the TileSet's ``tile_size`` value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_property_use_texture_padding"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **use_texture_padding** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_property_use_texture_padding)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_use_texture_padding**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_use_texture_padding**\ (\ )

If ``true``, generates an internal texture with an additional one pixel padding around each tile. Texture padding avoids a common artifact where lines appear between tiles.

Disabling this setting might lead a small performance improvement, as generating the internal texture requires both memory and processing time when the TileSetAtlasSource resource is modified.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_clear_tiles_outside_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_tiles_outside_texture**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_clear_tiles_outside_texture)

Removes all tiles that don't fit the available texture area. This method iterates over all the source's tiles, so it's advised to use [has_tiles_outside_texture()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_tiles_outside_texture) beforehand.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_alternative_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **create_alternative_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_id_override\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_alternative_tile)

Creates an alternative tile for the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`. If `alternative_id_override` is -1, give it an automatically generated unique ID, or assigns it the given ID otherwise.

Returns the new alternative identifier, or -1 if the alternative could not be created with a provided `alternative_id_override`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **create_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) = Vector2i(1, 1)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_tile)

Creates a new tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` with the given `size`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_atlas_grid_size"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_atlas_grid_size**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_atlas_grid_size)

Returns the atlas grid size, which depends on how many tiles can fit in the texture. It thus depends on the [texture](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture)'s size, the atlas [margins](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_margins), and the tiles' [texture_region_size](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture_region_size).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_next_alternative_tile_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_next_alternative_tile_id**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_next_alternative_tile_id)

Returns the alternative ID a following call to [create_alternative_tile()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_create_alternative_tile) would return.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_runtime_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **get_runtime_texture**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_runtime_texture)

If [use_texture_padding](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_use_texture_padding) is ``false``, returns [texture](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_texture). Otherwise, returns and internal [ImageTexture](ImageTexture.md) created that includes the padding.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_runtime_tile_texture_region"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Rect2i](Rect2i.md) **get_runtime_tile_texture_region**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frame\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_runtime_tile_texture_region)

Returns the region of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` for the given `frame` inside the texture returned by [get_runtime_texture()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_runtime_texture).

\ **Note:** If [use_texture_padding](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_property_use_texture_padding) is ``false``, returns the same as [get_tile_texture_region()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_texture_region).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_columns"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_tile_animation_columns**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_columns)

Returns how many columns the tile at `atlas_coords` has in its animation layout.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_frame_duration"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_tile_animation_frame_duration**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frame_index\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_frame_duration)

Returns the animation frame duration of frame `frame_index` for the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_frames_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_tile_animation_frames_count**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_frames_count)

Returns how many animation frames has the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode) **get_tile_animation_mode**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_mode)

Returns the tile animation mode of the tile at `atlas_coords`. See also [set_tile_animation_mode()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_mode).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_separation"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_tile_animation_separation**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_separation)

Returns the separation (as in the atlas grid) between each frame of an animated tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_speed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_tile_animation_speed**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_speed)

Returns the animation speed of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_total_duration"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_tile_animation_total_duration**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_total_duration)

Returns the sum of the sum of the frame durations of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`. This value needs to be divided by the animation speed to get the actual animation loop duration.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_at_coords"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_tile_at_coords**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_at_coords)

If there is a tile covering the `atlas_coords` coordinates, returns the top-left coordinates of the tile (thus its coordinate ID). Returns ``Vector2i(-1, -1)`` otherwise.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_data"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TileData](TileData.md) **get_tile_data**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_tile\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_data)

Returns the [TileData](TileData.md) object for the given atlas coordinates and alternative ID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_size_in_atlas"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_tile_size_in_atlas**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_size_in_atlas)

Returns the size of the tile (in the grid coordinates system) at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_texture_region"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Rect2i](Rect2i.md) **get_tile_texture_region**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frame\: [int](int.md) = 0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_texture_region)

Returns a tile's texture region in the atlas texture. For animated tiles, a `frame` argument might be provided for the different frames of the animation.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tiles_to_be_removed_on_change"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) **get_tiles_to_be_removed_on_change**\ (\ texture\: [Texture2D](Texture2D.md), margins\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), separation\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), texture_region_size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tiles_to_be_removed_on_change)

Returns an array of tiles coordinates ID that will be automatically removed when modifying one or several of those properties: `texture`, `margins`, `separation` or `texture_region_size`. This can be used to undo changes that would have caused tiles data loss.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_room_for_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_room_for_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), animation_columns\: [int](int.md), animation_separation\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frames_count\: [int](int.md), ignored_tile\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) = Vector2i(-1, -1)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_room_for_tile)

Returns whether there is enough room in an atlas to create/modify a tile with the given properties. If `ignored_tile` is provided, act as is the given tile was not present in the atlas. This may be used when you want to modify a tile's properties.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_tiles_outside_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_tiles_outside_texture**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_tiles_outside_texture)

Checks if the source has any tiles that don't fit the texture area (either partially or completely).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_move_tile_in_atlas"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **move_tile_in_atlas**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), new_atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) = Vector2i(-1, -1), new_size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) = Vector2i(-1, -1)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_move_tile_in_atlas)

Move the tile and its alternatives at the `atlas_coords` coordinates to the `new_atlas_coords` coordinates with the `new_size` size. This functions will fail if a tile is already present in the given area.

If `new_atlas_coords` is ``Vector2i(-1, -1)``, keeps the tile's coordinates. If `new_size` is ``Vector2i(-1, -1)``, keeps the tile's size.

To avoid an error, first check if a move is possible using [has_room_for_tile()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_has_room_for_tile).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_remove_alternative_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_alternative_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_tile\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_remove_alternative_tile)

Remove a tile's alternative with alternative ID `alternative_tile`.

Calling this function with `alternative_tile` equals to 0 will fail, as the base tile alternative cannot be removed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_remove_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_remove_tile)

Remove a tile and its alternative at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_alternative_tile_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_alternative_tile_id**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_tile\: [int](int.md), new_id\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_alternative_tile_id)

Change a tile's alternative ID from `alternative_tile` to `new_id`.

Calling this function with `new_id` of 0 will fail, as the base tile alternative cannot be moved.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_columns"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_columns**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frame_columns\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_columns)

Sets the number of columns in the animation layout of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`. If set to 0, then the different frames of the animation are laid out as a single horizontal line in the atlas.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_frame_duration"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_frame_duration**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frame_index\: [int](int.md), duration\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_frame_duration)

Sets the animation frame `duration` of frame `frame_index` for the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_frames_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_frames_count**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), frames_count\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_frames_count)

Sets how many animation frames the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` has.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_mode**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), mode\: [TileAnimationMode](TileSetAtlasSource.md#enum_TileSetAtlasSource_TileAnimationMode)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_mode)

Sets the tile animation mode of the tile at `atlas_coords` to `mode`. See also [get_tile_animation_mode()](TileSetAtlasSource.md#TileSetAtlasSource_method_get_tile_animation_mode).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_separation"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_separation**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), separation\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_separation)

Sets the margin (in grid tiles) between each tile in the animation layout of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` has.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_speed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_tile_animation_speed**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), speed\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSetAtlasSource_method_set_tile_animation_speed)

Sets the animation speed of the tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` has.
